content: Renegade soldiers have shot dead the president of the West African country of Guinea-Bissau, officials say. The killing of Joao Bernardo Vieira is thought to have been a revenge attack, after the army chief of staff died in an explosion a few hours earlier. The army denies there is a coup, and the capital Bissau is said to be quiet. Guinea-Bissau is one of the world's poorest states. It has a history of coups and has become a major transit route for smuggling cocaine to Europe. "http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/africa/7918061.stm"

title: Guinea-Bissau president shot dead

content: We'll see which colonel comes out on top. Then we'll know who did it - twice. But by that time he'll be approaching 'statesman' rank - after generalissimo and Emperor. Africa was more fun when the army would desert and take the gun with him.

content: >http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/africa/7921847.stm The BBC reports this interesting story that author Frederick Forsythe ( The Dogs of War, Day of the Jackal) was winess to events in Guinea-Bissau. He has a gruesome report on the killing of the President by army mutineers.
